instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Benq w1070 hdmi outputs not working
threads.message:
Hello.
I have had a benq w1070 projector that has 2 hdmi ports that don't work.

History.
I was told that it went through a power surge through an electrical storm.
however the customer informed me that he was still able to use 1 of the hdmi ports.
And it worked like that for a year until it went through another power surge.
Which he then lost the 2nd hdmi.

I have had a little look and it appears it's a good chance that it is the adv 7612

Anyone when experienced this before ?

threads.title: Benq w1070 hdmi outputs not working
threads.message:
5V rail to HDMI port should have a fuse.
If OK, then check diode mode to ground for all data lines...

threads.title: Benq w1070 hdmi outputs not working
threads.message:
Hello, sorry for delayed response.

I've tested some data and clock lines.
They are as follows.

Hdmi 1 ddc data 720
Hdmi 0 ddc data. 068

Hdmi 0 ddc clk 459
Hdmi 1 ddc clk 737

I have check dn44, dn52, dn51, dn42 all open port side and reading open line and on other side was reading 003

any help is appriciated

threads.title: Benq w1070 hdmi outputs not working
threads.message:
Correction

dn44, dn52, dn51, dn42
Are 002 on board side.
And all reading around 710 port side.
Sorry for the mix up

threads.title: Benq w1070 hdmi outputs not working
threads.message:
[LIST]
[*]Also on hdmi 1 I was getting s voltage reading on to 56 and 57 of 5v which I think is way high for a clock and data line.
[/LIST]

threads.title: Benq w1070 hdmi outputs not working
threads.message:
"Hdmi 0 ddc data. 068"
Looks like damaged HDMI block.
Remove any protection diode connected to ground on data lines and check again.

You named lot of components, but didn't provide any schematic.
